title: Emotional Sequential Influence Modeling on False Information
authors: Debashis Naskar, Subhashis Das, and Sara Rodriguez Gonzalez
abstract:
The extensive dissemination of false information in social networks affects
netizens social lives, morals, and behaviours. When a neighbour expresses
strong emotions (e.g., fear, anger, excitement) based on a false statement,
these emotions can be transmitted to others, especially through interactions on
social media. Therefore, exploring the mechanism that explains how an
individuals emotions change under the influence of a neighbours false statement
is a practically important task. In this work, we systematically examining the
publics personal, interpersonal, and historical emotional influence based on
social context, content, and emotional based features. The contribution of this
paper is to build an emotionally infused model called the Emotional based User
Sequential Influence Model(EUSIM) to understand users temporal emotional
propagation patterns and predict future emotions against false information.
